document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of the genus Protocypus J. Müller, 1923 (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Staphylinini) and two new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of the genus Protocypus J. Müller, 1923 (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Staphylinini) and two new species from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Eppelsheim, 1889 : 172 (
Ocypus
; subgenus
Goerius
; Type locality: Kan-ssu); Bernhauer and Schubert, 1914 : 386 (
Staphylinus
; subgenus
Ocypus
; catalog); J. Müller, 1923 : 196 (
Staphylinus
; subgenus
Protocypus
); Scheerpeltz, 1933 : 1393 (
Staphylinus
; synonym of
dorsalis
); J. Müller, 1943 : 97 (
Staphylinus
; subgenus
Protocypus
; valid species; characters); Smetana & Davies, 2000 : 33, 44 (
Ocypus
; subgenus
Pseudocypus
; lectotype designation); Herman, 2001 : 3378 (
Ocypus
; subgenus
Pseudocypus
; Catalog); Smetana, 2004 : 677 (
Ocypus
; subgenus
Pseudocypus
; Catalog of Palaearctic Region); Smetana, 2005 : 273 (
Protocypus
; redescription); Schülke & Smetana, 2015 : 1099 (
Protocypus
; Catalog of Palaearctic Region).

Syn.:
Staphylinus hauseri Bernhauer, 1933
( Type locality: Kalgan, Inn-shan, 980–2100 m ); Smetana & Davies, 2000 : 33, 44 (synonym of
fulvotomentosus
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3-1.
Protocypus fulvotomentosus
: A. habitus of species (2.0 mm); B. aedeagus, lateral view; (0.5 mm); C. aedeagus, ventral view (0.5 mm); D. underside of apical portion of paramere (0.5 mm); E. second gonocoxite of female genital segment (0.5mm). (Scale in parentheses).

FIGURE 3-2.
Protocypus fulvotomentosus
: A. male tergite 10; B and D. aedeagus, lateral view; C. aedeagus, ventral view; E. female tergite 10; F. apical portion of median lobe, ventral view, paramere removed; G. underside of apical portion of paramere; H. male sternite 9; I. second gonocoxite of female genital segment; J. male sternite 8 (Scale bars = 0.50 mm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution.
Protocypus fulvotomentosus
is at present known from Beijing , Gansu , Hebei , Ningxia and Shanxi .
